Posts.Content: SaxxyD just read that your legs are like lead weights, same here had my last Tax 21st June, got my inner self back but my legs are something else, i seriously need some strength in my legs to be able to physically carry on. how did you get a referral to physio? hugs SuperSue x
Posts.Title: Living alone

Posts.Content: Tinkers i bow down to you, how on earth have you coped, without the care love and attention from my darling i could not of managed especially on Tax, he even had to book time off work as i could not physically walk. Had 3 infections and could not have even thought about looking after anyone not even the fish. I think its a disgrace that people have to cope alone especially with children,  hugs and love to everyone, SuperSue. xxx
Posts.Title: Living alone

Posts.Content: Thanks for replying mumsie. yes i had my bloods checked they are fine. Yes your right about energy reserves i have none. Wonders is this why they only give you 6 chemo, as the body could not cope with any more, if i was just like i was after treatments 1-5 able to go for a small walk, slow stroll round tesco i'd be happy takes me all my effect to get dressed most days. I have not had a drink since finding out i had BC Dec 23rd, apart from 1 guinness on my 3rd week after treatment to bust my iron. Sue. x wanting to be Super again
Posts.Title: Fatigue and pain

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply Amanda Hugs you softly as know how you feeling, god i didn't expect to be feeling this bad, fed up of going from settee to bed and back again. Night sweats hot flushes start about 10pm every night., Good job i not got children to look after i couldn't do it, can't even look after myself!! Not used to sitting about i have a business to run, thank god thats in good hands too whilst i get better. Got another op on monday 23rd July they didn't get full clearance on my lumpectomy. luv Sue x wanting to be Super again
Posts.Title: Fatigue and pain

Posts.Content: I finished my chemo had 3 Fec & 3 Tax, having my last tax 23rd June, ended up with 3 infections and 3 lots of antibiotics whilst having treatments not nice at all. Since having my last chemo i just can not get any strength back and the pain are still lingering, aching legs severe lower back pain if i try do anything, I'm only able to walk to the kitchen and back before i start aching and breathing heavy, Just had my 4th lot of antibiotics for an ear infection, i have a cold that will not go away for 2 weeks and a lump on my neck at the front that does not hurt but clicks when i swallow and my ear still hurts. God i sound like a demic. How quickly should i get my strength and independence back, on the 3rd week after the other 5 chemo's i was able to get on with things now i feel 85 (i'm 52) whilst having treatment my partner has been wonderful and done everything for me has he done to much and me sitting here has made me fatigued, if so how can i get back up when i try it puts me back a day. Sue wanting to be SuperSue again x
Posts.Title: Fatigue and pain

Posts.Content: I'm on my waiting time after my op on the 9th Jan lumpectomy and full auxiliary clearance, my journey began with only needing 1cm lumpectomy, with radiation after to had full auxiliary clearance, will need chemo. I been brave unto now i not the sort of person that cries for pity, my C seems to have gone from being very early finding to overtaking my lymph nodes so quick, i now shaking with fear it gone further. Before it was found by chance i had been feeling so tired for months but had put that down to being over worked as self employed maybe it was, i tired all the time now but i know that the operation. Having a bad week, plus i decided to stop smoking on the 8th Jan maybe thats why i feeling so low. I just feeling like i want to scream, i want my brother too he died aged 48 on june 29th. oh gosh, can't see what i typing now, for the tears.
Posts.Title: Just need a hug

Posts.Content: thank you for your replies, they where all inspiring and made me smile at the friendliness this site gives, i know i will feel better tomorrow, just one of them days i not had a down day all week. in regard to smoking i got nicotine stuff i don't want to smoke, but at the moment i don't want the stress of not doing so gives on top of the C stress i have too. I think my thoughts are with everything i have achieved in the last 9 years after being through big shit (long story) everything was going so well everything was excellent, then my brother died and now shit has hit the brick again. why me i try so hard.  Tomorrow is another day, which will great! :-)
Posts.Title: Just need a hug

Posts.Content: Hi Georgie I had a lumpectomy on the 9th of jan and a full node clearance, not tried to wear a bra as when ii did the bottom edge was to tight on the scar, i have been wearing a lose vest top, but after a few days with doing the exercises movement eases. just bought a sports bra i going to try today. movement from the elbow to hand allows you to do normal movement hence me typing this now. hope your op goes well love n hugs sue x
Posts.Title: Hello
